Other Information.Additional Info: ZIF-62 demonstrates melting behavior and can form amorphous glass upon sintering, indicating potential size-selective properties.

Experimental Validation.Method: Hot pressing at 450Â°C under 15 MPa in a vacuum environment
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Formation of a mechanically strong bulk material with limited internal voids

Other Information.Additional Info: ZIF-62 undergoes solid-liquid phase transformation, making it suitable for hot pressing techniques. The sintered product shows potential applications in monolithic MOF structures.
ZIF-8 requires an ionic liquid to facilitate melting before decomposition, enabling liquid-phase sintering.

Experimental Validation.Method: Liquid-phase sintering facilitated by ionic liquid
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Formation of mechanically strong bulk materials with limited voids after extrusion of excess ionic liquid

Other Information.Additional Info: The addition of ionic liquid stabilizes the dissociating ZIF-8 ligands, reducing the melting temperature and enabling sintering.

Materials Name: ZIF-62 glass and metal halide perovskite composite

Other Information.Additional Info: The composite exhibits enhanced photoluminescence efficiency and stability due to liquid-phase sintering.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Orders of magnitude higher photoluminescence efficiency and significantly enhanced stability

Other Information.Additional Info: The sintered composite retains accessible microporous structures and shows promise for optoelectronic device applications.
